snippet: The rest of the world has traditionally looked up to Europe as an example to be emulated, but a new survey suggests its reputation is declining. Should nations worry about how much, or little, they are loved?
abstract: The rest of the world has traditionally looked up to Europe as an example to be emulated, but a new survey suggests its reputation is declining. Should nations worry about how much, or little, they are loved?

headline.main: Europe Slips in World Influence Stakes
